page.title: 09"Oink! Oink!"
page.content: On a 22-acre holding, employing two, there is an annual output of 35 tonnes of wheat, 14 tonnes of barley, all fed to the pigs. At any one time, 1000 pigs are on site, including 90 breeding sows and 5 boars. Each sow has 2.2 litter per year (one has had 14 litters and reared 134 pigs). Each sow eats 1 tonne of food per year. Over 400 tonnes is milled, mixed and fed to the pigs annually. About 1750 pigs go to market every year, representing about 400 tonnes of meat. Six thousand bales of straw are baled, stacked and spread. We cart 350 tonnes of farmyard manure and spread it annually on Mr. Sly's land for his potatoes, onions and sugar beet. After doing this, we can sit and watch the grass grow. P. Hall
